data.title: Duke basketball players who won an NBA title
data.meta_description: With Jayson Tatum in the NBA Finals and Dereck Lively and Kyrie Irving one win from joining him, here's a look at Duke's NBA champions.
data.text:
A former Duke basketball player will win the NBA Finals this season.

Jayson Tatum and the Boston Celtics won the Eastern Conference on Monday night, booking their second trip to the final series in three years. On the other side of the bracket, the Dallas Mavericks couldn’t close out the Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 4 of the Western Conference finals, but Kyrie Irving and Dereck Lively II’s team still leads the series 3-1. Even if Minnesota pulls off the miracle comeback, former Duke star Wendell Moore Jr. is on their bench.

Tatum, already the first Blue Devil with multiple All-NBA First Team nominations at 26 years old, could cement himself as the best NBA player in school history with a ring. Irving could make a similar claim with a title, however, as he already won a championship with the Cavaliers in 2016.

With the final stretch nearing, here’s a look back at every Duke basketball player who won an NBA title.

Jeff Mullins

Year: 1975

Team: Golden State Warriors

Danny Ferry

Year: 2003

Team: San Antonio Spurs

Shane Battier

Years: 2012, 2013

Team: Miami Heat

Kyrie Irving

Year: 2016

Team: Cleveland Cavaliers

Dahntay Jones

Year: 2016

Team: Cleveland Cavaliers

Quinn Cook

Years: 2018, 2020

Teams: Cleveland Cavaliers (2018), Los Angeles Lakers (2020)

Jack White

Year: 2023

Team: Denver Nuggets

Jayson Tatum

Year: 2024

Team: Boston Celtics
